entry.title: EWM - TM decentralized integration ( TU Integration ) - Batch information SYNC
entry.content:
Hi All 

I’m currently working on a project involving decentralized EWM integrated with TM, and I’d appreciate your expertise on the following question:

Do you have any insights regarding the batch information that flows back from EWM to the TM freight unit item? Specifically, should the country of origin be included as a standard part of the LDAP message?

Thank you in advance for your prompt response.

Best regards,
M. Eissa

 SAP S/4HANA SAP Transportation Management SAP Extended Warehouse Management EWM - Shipping and Receiving

entry.title: Staging of components from an external warehouse to an EWM warehouse
entry.content:
Hello SAP Gurus, 

In our business case, we have 2 Storage Locations under our plant. Lets call them A and B.

SLOC A is EWM managed. This is where all the production takes place. We have PSAs defined under this EWM warehouse. 

SLOC B is physically situated appx. 10 kms away. This SLOC is declared as a Decentralized Warehouse, run and managed by a 3rd party service provider. 

We have Production Orders, with some components that are stored in SLOC A (EWM warehouse), and some in SLOC B (Dec. warehouse).  The ones that are stored in SLOC B, needs to be moved from this dec. whse. to the PSAs. 

Most of the threads I have come across related to this situation suggests creation of STOs from SLOC B to A. But, is there an SAP standard functionality that can help us create such STOs automatically? Ideally, there should be a way to: 

1. Initiate staging of the components that are stored in the EWM whse to the PSAs, and simultaneously,

2. Automatic creation of the STOs of the components that are stored in the dec. whse. 

Is it somehow possible in SAP std? 

What makes the situation more tricky is that some components can sometimes be stored at both the locations. In that case, if enough stock is available at the EWM warehouse, system should not create the STOs, rather the SAP EWM staging requests. 

Are there any suggestions around this? Thanks for the pointers and leads in advance! 

Regards

Rahul Sharma

entry.title: How to start using SAP Warehouse Insights in the 2025?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have read a lot of information about SAP Warehouse Insights (WI) on the SAP Community ((Warehouse Insights – The planning and optimization... - SAP Community)). However, I am still not sure what steps are needed to start using WI, especially in a free trial version. By the way, I looked through the note 2863221, it provides steps when we have already connected with the systems (EWM, WI). So, my question here is how to start from scratch.

As far as I know, there are currently no free options to use WI on the some data centers (https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/can-it-still-be-used-warehouse-insights-trial/qaq-p/12510078), and I also do not see WI listed as an available service on the sap discovery center.

In addition, I also tried to find WI on the my employer's BTP sandbox and I found nothing.

Could you please provide more details on whether it is possible to start using SAP WI (free trial or otherwise)? Any guidance on how to get initial access would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

Best regards.

entry.title: SAP WM Public cloud storage bin Capacity check planning for putway.
entry.content:
Could you please explain how capacity planning functions in warehouse management within SAP Public Cloud?


The client’s requirement involves handling two types of storage bins:



  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.0 TO



  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.5 TO



There is a material called SS wire roll, which is procured from different suppliers and varies in weight. Using batch-specific units of measure during synchronous goods receipt, the process is as follows:



  • Material with a weight less than or equal to 1.0 TO should be placed in a 1.0 TO bin.



  • Material with a weight greater than 1.0 TO but less than or equal to 1.5 TO should be stored in a 1.5 TO bin



Additionally, if all 1.0 TO bins are full, materials weighing less than or equal to 1.0 TO may need to be placed in a 1.5 TO bin, with up to 4 quantities per bin depending on their size.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SQ01 dynamic date and time filters with timestamps
entry.content:
Hi,

 

SAP EWM tables often use timestamps (e.g. /SCWM/ORDIM_C).

Because of that I can't use dynamic date and time filter with SQ01 Queries.

 

Are there any possibilities to use dynamic date and time filters here?

 

Best regards

Jonas

entry.title: Multiple stock types (Avail.Grps with different storage locations) in one bin
entry.content:
Dear Support team,

Quick background of business case: At ***REMOVED BY MODERATION*** we would like to store multiple stock types (availability groups linked to different storage locations) in one storage bin. However, we also would like to use standard best practice with ROD and AFS concept. And we think both can not be achived in standard, unless we've missed some new functionality in public cloud. 

One way could have been is to enhacne it, in order to have the stock type changing during the putaway warehouse task confirmation in final bin, there we do not have any standard BADI available in cloud. Therefore could you please suggest a workaround or possibility to have access to BADI.

Thank a lot for your great support.

***REMOVED BY MODERATION***


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Career Advice: Choosing Between SAP Ariba, EWM, and PP
entry.content:
Hello, 

I’m an Industrial Engineer with no prior work experience, but I speak four languages — English, German, Turkish, and Arabic. I’ve recently completed hands-on training in SAP MM and am now planning to learn another SAP module to strengthen my career path.

My goal is to build a strong professional profile and find good job opportunities in the Gulf region, where SAP is in high demand. I want to choose a module that aligns with my industrial engineering background, complements my SAP MM knowledge, leverages my language skills, and offers long-term career stability — even with the growing impact of AI and automation.

Currently, I’m considering 1) SAP Ariba(e.g., Procurement, Supplier Management, Sourcing ..) and 2) SAP EWM. I am also thinking about SAP PP, but I believe its opportunities are limited, as it is mostly confined to the industrial sector. Additionally, I would like advice on whether to focus on Cloud Private Edition or On-Premise for SAP MM and the next module.

Which module and deployment type would you recommend to help me stay competitive and future-proof my career in the Gulf market?

Thank you very much for your advice!

entry.title: No business partner found for ERP partner 0000000000 (role:LF)

2. We have created an OBD and configured output type SPED (this is a STO scenario) to create the IBD at GI on the OBD.

3. The issue is that the IBD is created without a ship to party: Attached is the error from the queue. 3109 is the supply plant and 3102 is the receiving plant

Any suggestion will be highly appreciated.

Br

Auddy

entry.title: MM/SD VAS integration with SAP EWM
entry.content:
Good Morning, 

 

In the S/4HANA Fashion Retail environment, Value-Added Services (VAS) such as labeling, repacking, and ticketing need to be executed and tracked when processes are integrated with EWM Basic.

 

Currently, VAS steps are not triggered or integrated during Stock Transport Orders and Sales Orders processed through EWM Basic, causing inconsistencies and manual work in warehouse operations.

 

ations.

entry.title: Unified Package Builder - usage in decentral vs. embedded deployment TM/EWM
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I have a question regarding usage of the Unified Package Builder (UPB) in a decentral deployment scenario:
S/4HANA ERP on-prem system where sales orders/deliveries get created and a decentral S/4 TM system (2023 release).

In the scenario the early package building for the TM Freight Units should be done, ideally with using the packing instruction as UPB engine.
But the master data and the LE packing instructions reside on the S/4 ERP instance and not in the TM-system.
Question: is it somehow possible to use the UPB API (interface /SCWM/IF_PACKING_UPB) in a remote call manner?
Or is it like with EWM that if using the UPB it has to be ensured that all master data for packing (like e.g. LE packaging instructions) must reside in the same system as the UPB? Has anyone come across this kind of scenario?

Thank You.
Kind regards,
Beata

entry.title: Message No. SR053- No access to storage unit conversion table
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Need your help to find a solution to fix the issue in Inbound delivery distribution.

while distributing inbound dlvy from to EWM, the delivery is stuck in the queue with error NO access storage unit conversion table. I have created a delivery with 2 material in a HU and distributed but the delivery failed to show up in EWM due to above issue. Does anyone has any suggestion how to fix this issue.

Please help. 

Thank you for your time

Regards,

Venkat

entry.title: POSC Steps not determined in Distribution Equipment Process.
entry.content:
I have defined Storage Process as DEP1 with 4 steps (OB01 --> DE01 --> DE02 --> DE03), picking(0), staging(1), loading(2) and unloading(3) respectively.

Consider 0 1 2 3 as storage types

DE01 and DE02 has auto WT checkbox.
For each external step DE01, DE02, DE03. Source St , WPT , Destination St and Destination bin is also maintained in the configuration.

also I have maintained DE01 in 1 storage type as external step.


Now, After i'm creating a JIT stock transfer call and creating Tour from report. I manually creating WT in Monitor for Picking.

1. After picking the HU and moving it to Staging area my OB01 is getting completed along with this my whole Transfer to PSA status, WMR document is getting completed and there is no further steps determined.

2. I cannot see further logs or any open WT for DE02 or next steps.

In your opinion, which version is better to focus on for building a strong and future-oriented SAP career?

Thank you..

entry.title: WM Material Staging successful but no delivery
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I try to execute WM staging for my production order. I create the order in CO01 and released it successfuly.

Afterwards I go into transaction CO02 and with Functions>WM Material staging>Execute I execute WM Material staging. When I look into the log, I can see that WM staging was executed without error.

But I cannot see a delivery in EWM to stage the material.

I already created control cycle and entry in /SCWM/PSASTAGE. I also created a Production scheduling Profile like following.

When I try the staging in LP10, I get the following error.

Does anyone have an Idea what the issue is?

Thanks and Best regards

Kadir
